date.headline: View of NCT00000193 on 2005_06_23
date.text:
ClinicalTrials Identifier:NCT00000193
Updated:2005_06_23

Descriptive Information
Brief title

Neurobiology of Opioid Dependence: 2 - 2
Official title

Neurobiology of Opioid Dependence: 2
Brief summary

The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of gamma hydroxybutyric on naloxone-precipitated opiate withdrawal.
Detailed description

PhasePhase 2
Study typeInterventional
Study designTreatment
Study designDouble Blind
Study designPlacebo Control
Primary outcomeMeasure: Behavioral, subjective, measures of naloxone-preci
Primary outcomeMeasure: Phsyiological, neuroendocrine measures of naloxone
Condition Opioid-Related Disorders
Intervention
Drug: Gamma hydroxybutyric
Reference
Citation: Neuropsychopharmacology, 1996; 14(3) pp 187-193. Neruopsychopharmacology 1996; 14(3), 187-193
MEDLINE:

Recruitment Information
Status Completed
Start date 1996-01
Last data entry date 1996-10
Criteria

Please contact site for information.
Gender Male
Minimum ageN/A
Maximum ageN/A
Healthy volunteersNo
Expected enrollment0

Administrative Data
Organization nameNational Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)
Organization study IDNIDA-00191-2
Secondary ID K20-00191-2
Sponsor National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA)
Collaborator Yale University
Health Authority United States: Federal Government
